Reviews.Title: “Good location for Levent but poor services, average food, and bad heat control in rooms”
Reviews.Author: GuvSisteron
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well placed for a business traveller involved with finance district meetings in Levent. But the food is at best average and the gym and spa impossible to access during the end of work hours as its small and the hotel have clearly sold memberships to non hotel residents. I personally wouldn't even join as local resident as there are already far too many members and it was impossible on the three evenings I have stayed here to access anything from 18.00 to 20.00. The rooms are overheated and the central AC doesn't work effectively, impossibel to open a window as teh rooms are facing a 6 lane highway constantly filled. The television in theory has many English speaking channels but none were actually available during my stay; a complete first, normally at least CNN is everywhere. There was CNN but only in Turkish.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: DOINA_ALEXANDRA
Reviews.Content: We have been to Istanbul already for the fourth time in the last 8 months and everytime we stayed at Avantgarde Hotel. We found it very nice from the very beginning, with a very good position to go everywhere you want very easy, not to mention that is very close to the metro station and Metro City Mall. Hotel staff is very kind and helpfull, rooms are very clean, with a stylish look and I really have to mention the comfortable sleeping. Breakfast is always fresh and very tasty. Gym facilities are basic, but, from our point of view, sufficient. It has also free facilities for Turkish bath and sauna which we found very relaxing. During our last visit to Istanbul, from the moment that we walked into the building, we were welcomed very kindly, the staff already knew our names, so we practically felt like "home". And now I think we became addicted to Avantgarde Hotel, so definitely we will recommend it to our friends for theirs trips and for sure we will choose it every time we will come again. And last, but not least, we would like to address special thanks to Mr Tanay Adiguzel - Hotel Manager, who made each our staying at Avantgarde more than a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Avantgarde really??”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie42
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a decent location, is rather expensive, but is worth it. I have stayed in larger rooms in Istanbul and the bathrooms are small. The rooms are very modern, love the little amenities [chocolate and turkish treats!!!] and the location is great for walking around. It is a fair hike to the airport for fine for spending time in Istanbul. Hotel staff was very helpful and spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JudgeQ
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times. It has an excellent atmosphere, clean and a central location. Not forgetting the extremely friendly and helpful staff. During my last stay on the 15th of February the front desk employee (Thank you Mr. Murat Can) was following up with me upon arrival regarding the airport pick-up through email. Which was great and goes to show what their customer service is at a higher standard than the rest. Avantgarde hotel is on the top of my list when I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “YOU WILL FORGET THE OTHERS”
Reviews.Author: ADAM C
Reviews.Content: THE BEST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN ISTANBUL. Perfect location. Very polite,friendly concierge and reception, hotel smeels like rose garden..Very clean rooms..Breakfast fresh and food is very rich. You become addicted to Avantgarde...

Reviews.Title: “Clean restaurant perfect for business”
Reviews.Author: Einzelganger
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit out of the center and more to the business district and situated near a main road with quite a bit of traffic. Despite it is difficult to cross the road, inside the room the noise was not bothersome. There is a shopping center on walking distance with a Migros (direction: Besiktas). Very handy to get some water, etc. as the minibar is quite expensive. At the reception they speak decent English and are reasonably helpfull. It didn't help though that in fist half of the morning the reception is staffed with one person. The rooms are nice and clean and well furnitured (European standard). But seeing the price you should expect some luxury. There is a pillow menu. Breakfast is also good. Though as a male you have to ask a bit more often for a refill as ladies get more attention. The bellboy did not help me with luggage (but I travel light, maybe that's why). But he gave me nice directions to the shopping mall and was further helpfull. The restaurant is quite expensive (portions are small), but excells in desserts. Especially the one with white chocolate is delicious. Be aware that the airport transfer service is quite expensive. Especially as they also charge a service fee of 14EUR on top of the transfer fee they communicate. WIFI was poor at my room. But all rooms have a wall plug for internet and they issue internet cables if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “they could not give bad service”
Reviews.Author: MRT78
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in Istanbul again and i really enjoyed too much. Same good quality,same hygen,same fantastic staff. They were very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: skoddehauk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several time at this small business hotel in the business center of Istanbul.Gym facilities are basic but sufficient.Free internet, clean, but small rooms and the breakfast is quite standard. For business purposes, this is a fine hotel, but I would go elsewhere if I went to Istanbul with my wife and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Like home...”
Reviews.Author: Don P
Reviews.Content: We had a very peaceful and a happy stay with my wife. Personnel is acting very warm and close. You feel yourself like at home, the hotel where the transportation is very convenient in terms of location. I would recommend to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: BeRnArDa2608
Reviews.Content: hotel staff very helpfull and to get right information about shopping areas, how we can go that places. Most of shopping malls very closed to hotel and you can go there by walking alternative option to use public transportation like subway ( without any traffic problem) If you want to go dinner or night life to easy way is take a taxi and to go bosphorus line And also can get relax in hotel spa ( there are turkish bath, indoor pool and many treatments)

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel but comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ckanchan
Reviews.Content: It is a small business hotel in the city center of the Instanbul. It has indoor swimming pool, though it was being maintained when I stayed in the hotel during early 2011. Gym facilities were basic but sufficient. It has got free facilities for Turkish bath, sauna etc, for which I did not have time. If my memory serves well, internet in the room was free. Room was not that spacious but enough for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind traffic and cigarette smoke, it's fine”
Reviews.Author: Anders R
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff - even though English is a great difficulty for pretty much the entire staff except a few of the people at the front desk. However, had to change rooms twice during my stay. First because of a "technical issue" on my floor and secondly, upon my own request, due to constant smell of cigarette smoke. Changing to another floor didn't entirely remove this, so - don't go if you are sensitive to smell. The hotel is 5 min walk from the metro, but you will notice that the air pollution is very heavy due to the 5-lane-highways and junctions right outside the main door. This also gives a great deal of "traffic ambience" in the rooms. Food at the two restaurants is quite overpriced and poor. Low quality produce cannot be masked by clever toppings and fancy shape dishes. Recommend getting your food elsewhere. Breakfast is ok, but as a european traveller, you will get bored from the lack of choice very quickly. (Same low quality produce at breakfast - you'll find bruised fruits and dry bread) In other words - not good, but not very bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some faults”
Reviews.Author: ã�²ã‚�ã�—ã‚¢ãƒ³ã‚«ãƒ©
Reviews.Content: I stayed Avantgarde hotel with my wife. It's clean and decent. Receptionists were generally good. However there was exception. My wife and I had different businesses in Istanbul so we asked 2nd card-key. But this request was rejected. (Card-key is necessary for elevator, everytime i returned to hotel, I had to find out bell-man to use elevator. I think it's good for business guests, but not for couples(There are amenities and towels just for 1 person initially.)

Reviews.Title: “*** Three star- nothing more”
Reviews.Author: xr00024
Reviews.Content: New hotel with incompetent personnel. Have stayed for five days in June 2011. The hotel is in a high traffic area. If you want to sleep well pick-up a room at a higher floor. Rooms are clean but the one I got had a half bathroom (the sink was in the room so if you want to wash your face /teeth and stay with a partner they will hear everything loud and clear). Breakfast is Turkish style (cheese, olives etc) and doesn't change. If you stay longer than three days you will get bored by it. Personnel is incompetent. I had to manage the cleaning team myself to get a decent living. Most pretend they speak English: pay attention, they will always tell you yes but most of the times they will not understand to what they have committed. I have asked the concierge for a taxi to the airport. I got one with the trunk half filled with speakers. So we had to squeeze most of the luggage inside the car. If you live in the civilized world , this is a three star hotel. Nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERRRR”
Reviews.Author: MRT78
Reviews.Content: I had my business trip to Istanbul on July. It was my first time in Istanbul. I really enjoyed staying in Avantgarde Hotel. The service was perfect. Staff was helpfull.If I come to Istanbul again I definetly choose Avantgarde Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PickyYay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at my friends room only one night, as I had problems in my hotel. When we came to reception it made no problem for me to stay, however the room was booked for one person. They charged 10 euro for breakfast and were very friendly. The room is not big, i would say small. But it was not a problem, because it was very cosy and nice. Bathroom is clean and with nice design as well. I liked the hotel. Breakfast was fresh and tasty, and the restaurant is very light and accurate. I recommend this hotel definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: AydinSoh
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel. It's 5-10 minute walking distance from the Levent and also Gayrettepe metro stations. Access to both the Taksim and Etiler areas is good. and the hotel is located in the neighbourhood of shopping centers Metrocity, Kanyon, Akmerkez, and Levent carsi. We did not try the food (except breakfast) or any other facilities so I can only give my opinion on the room and the staff. The hotel is located by a busy street, but our street-view room was so quiet; rooms was comfortable and clean, the bathroom was excellent. Although in some booking websites it is described that there are tea and coffee amenities in the rooms but ours did not have. The breakfast does not have so much choices however was acceptable. The staff were friendly and helpful (esp. concierge).

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nutchism
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and was very happy. Friendly service, free fast WiFi available throughout the hotel, good food at the restaurant, great room with a comfy bed and close to a couple of great shopping malls. Taksim Square and Bebek are each about a 20 lira cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but too expensive for what they offer.”
Reviews.Author: Pixy76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is newer, rooms are clean and the furniture is new. So you have a good feeling staying at the room. Internet is free of charge. The bathroom is also nice, but if you are older or have problems with your back or with anything you might have difficulties to climb into the bath - there is a wooden stair which is not fixed. The staff at the reception is friendly, but slow. When checking out I took time they printed all the receipts etc. Within walking distance (cca 10 min) is a shopping center - international brands, food court. It is ok. About 20 min by car to Blue mosque ion one direction, 20 min to the seaside - Bebek area, where are some nice restaurants with sea view. Actually staying in this hotel is nothing outstanding - normal boutique hotel, clean, specious enough. We had a good rate, but normal rate is way too high for what they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: parnader
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived , I found out that everything I read about this hotel in reviews were definitely right. Hotel staff were friendly specially front desk manager, who arranged for us a grand deluxe room instead of deluxe room. The room was really good and I felt very comfortable. House keeping were very responsible and they did their best. Another thing I enjoyed was the breakfast, specially the last part! A coffee with a peace of apple pie. This is a great hotel and I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “There is nothing better than being treated like a VIP!”
Reviews.Author: mk1704
Reviews.Content: During a recent visit to Istanbul I stayed at the AvanteGarde Hotel and was so impressed with all the services! From the moment I walked in the door, I was welcomed with warmth and kindness. Everybody went out of their way to make me feel comfortable and at home. From the front desk manager who was constantly checking in with me to see how I was doing, arranging a personal tour of the Grand Bazaar with one of the doormen to the morning restaurant manager/servers who made sure I had an English copy of the local papers and my 3 cups of coffee - I thought the service was superb! Kudos to the Chef and her/his wonderful food. I loved knowing that breakfast was part of my stay and that I could have homemade borreks, a plethora of cheeses, fresh vegetables and fruits everyday - what a treat! When it came to the room, the space was spotless, spacious and very comfortable. I loved the bedding and slept better there than I do in my own bed. This is a great hotel and you will enjoy your stay in the business district. Its true what they way, the Turks are warm and inviting and know how to make visitors feel welcomed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Job - Would Return”
Reviews.Author: 1whereintheworldami1
Reviews.Content: I travel to Istanbul frequently for business. This hotel is definitely well appointed for its price point. The rooms are modern and clean. Internet through the building. Nice breakfast was offered. The staff was attentive and knew my name. If you are a tourist looking to see the historic sites, it is a bit far away, but if you are in town for business it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & fabulous service!”
Reviews.Author: I_Andrabi
Reviews.Content: It was our 2nd trip to Istanbul in 5 years. The first time we had stayed at Movenpick. Our primary reason for selecting Avantgarde hotel was that we had read some fantastic reviews. The hotel is exactly like it appears in the pictures - very high standard of cleanliness and quality linens, crockery and service! The icing on the cake was the front desk manager Mr. Ilter Turkmenoglu's who's personal attention and patience made our trip worthwhile. From arranging tickets to a whirling dervaish performance to providing suitable option to make a 2 day trip to Ephesus and Pamukale (worth seeing sites in Turkey!) without forcing us to make a decision, Mr. Ilter was willing to help at all times. The staff at the reception and at the entrance and room service - everyone seemed to be ready to be of assistance with a smile. The hotel is within walking distance from the metro station which takes a few minutes to reach Taksim square. If you haven't been to Istanbul before trust me you want to use the metro and trams to commute as it's affordable and saves you lots of time by avoiding all the traffic on the roads. For our next trip to Istanbul we will definitely stay at Avantgarde hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for the occasional Istanbul tourist”
Reviews.Author: khalaf007
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy staying at the Avantgarde Hotel, and have visited 3 times in the last 12 months. The hotel is genuinely on par with the Swissotel and other similarly well known Istanbul hotels but offers a distinctly warmer approach with true Ottoman hospitality and style. Whilst the hotel is clearly quite new and devoid of any signs of ageing, it is also immaculately maintained. All the bathroom's I have had on my visits have been different, but each beautifully appointed. I even asked the reception staff where they found the tiles and they were kind enough to forward me the supplier's contact information. The staff here are ALL friendly. I arrived at midnight in the pouring rain to check in for my stay. The chap who opened the door of the taxi holding the umbrella knew my name and welcomed me despite the late hour and horrible weather he was standing in. Similarly, the reception desk asked how my journey had been and offered me a drink whilst I waited for my bags to be taken up and all paperwork to be sorted out. For the price you pay, this hotel is far better than the Swissotel. Its better appointed, offers a great location to get around Istanbul from and the staff are genuinely friendly. I dined one evening at the hotel restaurant, "Ace" where the food was surprisingly good. All our group were pleasantly surprised at how good the food was and two of them asked the chef for the recipe to their fabulous tiramisu and pumpkin desserts. Similarly, the breakfast buffet was excellent and would put many more pricy hotels to shame. Whoever manages or runs this hotel still cares about customer service and their guests. Many other larger branded franchises could learn alot from this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: GOURMET2004
Reviews.Content: I had my business trip to Istanbul last month.And my stay in Avantgarde hotel was absolutely perfect.The hotel is in the middle of the business area.Very close to underground station abd city center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: ThomasJ74
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel, very clean, nice room, nice washroom and extremely friendly staff. Even send a guy to show us actual location of recommended restaurant (maybe 300 m walk). Breakfast is good, beds comfortable and free internet. Business center has several computers, free printer etc. Located right next to 2 shoppingcentres.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable room, friendly staff, but built next to a busy road...”
Reviews.Author: Newsbunny
Reviews.Content: Try to get a room away from the roadside. Even at 3am there is no let up in the traffic but i guess that's the way with all of Istanbul. The staff are very helpful....particularily the restaurant staff....but to be honest the food is a bit of a let down. Great service but he menu is dull. Practically nothing Turkish on the menu. Businesss facilities are good. Room was clean and comfortable but I wish I had been able to open a window. The whole place had a slighly claustrophobic feel about it. Could do with some daylight!

Reviews.Title: “Nice design and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: mhola
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Avantgarde Hotel for 3 nights during the Trade Fair taking place in Istanbul. The hotel is very nice, nice large rooms.. We visited with my colleague the hotel restaurant and experienced very nice food, atmosphere and very friendly staff who was happy to help us with the food choice and had full knowledge of the served dishes. I will recommend Avantgarde hotel to my colleagues and friends for their future business or leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Central, modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: carice59
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, rooms are very comfortable and clean. Central, thanks to metro station close by, I was able to go everywhere easily. I was especially impressed by the modern design which gave this place an air of tranquility in the midst of a very busy business district.

HotelInfo.Name: Avantgarde Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Buyukdere Cad. 161, Istanbul 34394, Turkey
